title: Why are genetically modified foods produced? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because Agribiz is trying desperately to find a way to feed 7.5 billion people. Personally, I don’t think it’s the way to go. Every organism in an ecosystem needs to evolve with all the other organisms around it. These days, animal fodder is mostly what’s engineered, and it’s to have resistance to things like glyphosate. The problem with that is the advent of “Superweeds”. A plant will come along that is resistant to this herbicide, and pretty soon you need something new to spray on the crops. That is, until weeds develop a resistance to that one too, and on it goes. I’m not saying that I have all the answers, but I know that GMO’s aren’t it.

All the fruits and vegetables we eat are genetically modified because the original plant was a weed and it was mostly inedible. We have been modifying weeds to turn them into food since before recorded history. The whole anti-GMO movement is an embarrassment to educated people. In fact the chickens, cows and pigs we eat are also modified from their original wild species so they are better suited for eating.

There are many reasons but one of the primary ones is so they can be saturated with Round-Up (glyphosate) and not be killed while all other plants DIE. If you like consuming foods that have been saturated with Round-Up, enjoy your GMO foods. Personally, I always look for this label:
Genetic modification has many lofty aims. But in practice it boils down to pesticide tolerance,herbicide tolerance and terminator genes. Actually all business tricks.
Which food that you eat today is not a GMO or a Hybrid, answer this and I will give you a whole list of GMO food. Brocolli seemly very healthy veggie never existed on this planet.
